VPR.A: The heatmap shows a {radial gradient} pattern.

EVJ.Q: What is the global maximum heat value in the heatmap?
EVJ.A: The global maximum heat value is {0.94}.

EVJ.A: The global minimum heat value is {0.14}.

EVJ.Q: What is the maximum heat value of label Electricity on the x-axis?
EVJ.A: The maximum heat value of Electricity on the x-axis is {0.89}.

EVJ.Q: What is the maximum heat value for label Storage on the y-axis?

SC.Q: What is the average heat value for label Transmission on the x-axis?
SC.A: The average heat value for Transmission on the x-axis is {0.54}.

NC.Q: Which has the higher heat value: the cell corresponding to Electricity and Infrastructure or the cell corresponding to Electricity and Prices?
NC.A: The cell corresponding to {Electricity} and {Infrastructure} has a higher heat value.

NC.Q: Which has the higher heat value: the cell corresponding to Water and Emissions or the cell corresponding to Water and Technology?
NC.A: The cell corresponding to {Water} and {Emissions} has a higher heat value.

NC.Q: Which has the higher heat value: the cell corresponding to Coal and Emissions or the cell corresponding to Renewables and Prices?
NC.A: The cell corresponding to {Coal} and {Emissions} has a higher heat value.

MSR.Q: In the heatmap, what are the row and column labels for all cells whose heat values fall within the range of 0.70 to 0.88?
MSR.A: The cells are: {(Exploration, Consumption), (Nuclear, Consumption), (Renewables, Consumption), (Transmission, Consumption), (Distribution, Efficiency), (Electricity, Efficiency), (Exploration, Efficiency), (Nuclear, Efficiency), (Renewables, Efficiency), (Distribution, Emissions), (Electricity, Emissions), (Exploration, Emissions), (Nuclear, Emissions), (Renewables, Emissions), (Coal, Infrastructure), (Distribution, Infrastructure), (Electricity, Infrastructure), (Exploration, Infrastructure), (Nuclear, Infrastructure), (Coal, Investment), (Distribution, Investment), (Electricity, Investment), (Exploration, Investment), (Coal, Policy), (Distribution, Policy)}.
